item.title: John Hancock Announces New Chairperson of the John Hancock Group of Funds Board of Trustees
item.description: [PR Newswire] - BOSTON, Jan. 13, 2017 /PRNewswire/ -- We are pleased to announce that Hassell H. McClellan has succeeded James M. Oates as Chairperson of the Board of Trustees. Mr. McClellan brings a wealth of experience to his new position, having been a professor of finance and policy and associate dean at Boston College's Wallace E. Carroll School of Management and a director of both public and privately held companies. Mr. Oates has served as Chairperson of the Board of the John Hancock Group of Funds with distinction since 2005, providing steady guidance during a period of phenomenal growth and challenges.

item.title: Manulife Employees in Canada Receive $10,000 Per Year in Mental Health Benefits
item.description: [PR Newswire] - WATERLOO, ON, Jan. 11, 2017 /CNW/ - Under its redesigned benefits plan, Manulife employees will now receive a mental health support benefit up to $10,000 per person per year, including family members. This amount represents among the highest mental health benefits offered by Canadian employers. According to the Canadian Mental Health Association, an estimated one in five Canadians will experience a mental illness in their lifetime.

item.description: [CNW Group] - Manulife Investments Announces Special Meetings of Securityholders

item.title: Manulife Investments Announces Special Meetings of Securityholders
item.description: [PR Newswire] - TORONTO, Jan. 9, 2017 /CNW/ - Manulife Investments today announced its plans to replace certain operating expenses of the Manulife U.S. All Cap Equity Class (Advisor Series and Series T6) and Manulife Global Balanced Private Trust (Advisor Series, Series L, Series LT6, Series T6) with fixed administration fees. The change to a fixed administration fee model will include management fee reductions.

item.title: John Hancock Investments launches national advertising campaign
item.description: [PR Newswire] - BOSTON, Jan. 9, 2017 /PRNewswire/ -- John Hancock Investments today announced the start of a national TV advertising campaign designed to communicate the benefits of the firm's unique multimanager approach to investing. The ads highlight the investing power in John Hancock's far-reaching network of specialized asset managers, the rigor of the firm's manager selection and oversight processes, and the strength of its strategic beta ETFs. "We're excited about this campaign," said Andrew G. Arnott, President and CEO of John Hancock Investments.
